isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CLUTCH CONTROL LINKAGE - 1000 SERIES - REPLACEMENT - RELAY SHAFT BUSHING

step1.para: Disconnect the upper and lower clutch rods from the relay levers by removing the cotter and clevis pins ( Figure 4).
Remove the relay shaft bolts and lockwashers.
Remove the relay shaft and remove the relay lever (bellcrank) assembly and bushings.
Discard the old bushings. Inspect the relay shaft and relay lever (bellcrank) assembly and replace if worn or damaged. Replace the clutch rod clevis pins, if worn.
Lubricate the inside and outside diameters of new bushings with grease. Use 251H EP grease or an equivalent NLGl #2 multi-purpose lithium grease.
Position the bushings in the relay lever (bellcrank) assembly.
Position the relay lever (bellcrank) assembly between the relay shaft brackets. Install the relay shaft.
Install the lockwashers and relay shaft bolts. Tighten bolts to 50 to 60 ft-lbs. (68 to 81 N•m). Be sure relay lever assembly pivots freely after tightening the bolts.
Connect the upper and lower clutch rods to the relay levers and install new cotter pins. Lubricate clevis pins with a light coat of grease.
Lubricate the relay lever assembly through lubrication fitting. (See step 5 for grease specification.)

Check the clutch control adjustments and re-adjust as needed. Refer to ADJUSTMENT
.
